extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 6 heads baby bok choy, cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: baby bok choy, cut in half lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, more as needed

extendedIngredients.name: soy sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1 Tbsp soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce for gluten-free version of recipe)
extendedIngredients.originalName: soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce for gluten-free version of recipe)

extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.original: 1 teaspoon cornstarch mixed with a tablespoon of cold water
extendedIngredients.originalName: cornstarch mixed with a tablespoon of cold water
meta: with a tablespoon of cold water

extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 to 1/2 cup of thinly sliced prosciutto cut into 1/4-inch strips, or finely chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced prosciutto cut into 1/4-inch strips, or finely chopped

title: Baby Bok Choy with Sherry and Prosciutto
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Baby Bok Choy with Sherry and Prosciutto a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 1g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 58 calories. This gluten free and dairy free recipe serves 4 and costs 44 cents per serving. A couple people made this recipe, and 34 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up extra virgin olive oil, chicken broth, kosher salt, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. It is brought to you by Simply Recipes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 0%, which is very bad (but still fixable). Baby Bok Choy With Sherry and Prosciutto, Braised Bok Choy With Sherry & Prosciutto, and Shanghai Bok Choy/ Baby Bok Choy (2 in 1 Meals) are very similar to this recipe.
instructions:
Cook the garlic: Put the oil and garlic into a large, heavy-based sauté pan with a lid. Heat on medium high heat and cook, stirring frequently until the garlic begins to sizzle, about 1 minute.

Add the bok choy, then sherry: Add the baby bok choy halves. Use tongs to turn the pieces in the oil. Season with salt. When the bok choy leaves begin to wilt, add the sherry, turning the pieces again.

Add broth, soy sauce, sugar, cover and simmer: Add the chicken broth, soy sauce, and sugar. Reduce the heat to medium. Cover and simmer until the bok choy tops are wilted and the stalks are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.
Using tongs, transfer the bok choy to a plate, leaving the cooking fluid in the pan.

Add cornstarch slurry: Whisk the cornstarch slurry into the cooking fluid. Simmer until liquid has thickened, about 30 seconds.
Remove the pan from the heat.

Add the bok choy and prosciutto: Add the bok choy back to the pan. Add the prosciutto and toss quickly to coat the bok choy with the broth and mix with the prosciutto. Season to taste with salt. Serve immediately.
